blog.name: thefeministherald
blog.title: The Feminist Herald
blog.description: Brief Feminist Updates.  Feminism: Supporting the fight against the oppression of women through activism and the interrogation of the tools used to create and perpetuate a social system that oppresses women in order to afford privilege to men, especially white men. Tools like misogynistic narratives, ideas and attitudes and their use in politics, the media, education and all other social institutions and constructs. In addition, examining and pointing out how racism, homophobia and other oppressive systems and forms of discrimination intersect with misogynistic ideas creating hybrid attitudes, narratives and ideas against women of color, LGBT women, women with disabilities and other women who face those forms of discrimination.

summary: The Merch for Captain Marvel Is So Good, It May Bring a Tear to Your Eye
body:
The Merch for Captain Marvel Is So Good, It May Bring a Tear to Your Eye

A big superhero movie having merchandise isn’t news. Every movie gets t-shirts and Funko pops and all that stuff. But, for Captain Marvel, Marvel’s first superhero film with a woman in the lead, the studio is going above and beyond. There’s jewelry, there’s a bicycle, there are amazing jackets, and it’s all so gorgeous, it may just bring a tear to your eye.

At any rate, it’ll definitely make fans reach for their wallets. The official Marvel website shared all of these images and we won’t post them all, but here are just a few of the highlights of this awesomeness.

And again, that’s just a little bit. There are toys, Lego, Funko, and way more apparel. It’s a truly impressive line up for what we hope is a truly impressive movie.

It’s especially impressive when you remember back to just a few years ago, when Disney all but forgot the lead character of another big, blockbuster movie, Rey, in that film’s merchandising. Maybe, just maybe, things are actually changing. See more merch at these two links.

The bracelet! 😍 Also, the dress! And the jacket! And the watch! So cool and beautiful 😍😭

Holiday gift mode activated!

summary: Valerie, Tatiana and Angela gush over the latest Captain Marvel trailer and wonder about Maria Rambeau's role in the film (1:30)...
caption:
Valerie, Tatiana and Angela gush over the latest Captain Marvel trailer and wonder about Maria Rambeau’s role in the film (1:30) before discussing the rest of the announced and/or upcoming Marvel and DC movies (13:00). On the other end of the spectrum, we mourn the Daredevil cancellation and the death of Netflix Marvel (16:50). Then we take a depressing look at two more men accused of being trash (23:50). But things get joyful again with our mini-review of The Flash’s 100th episode (40:30), a preview of Counterpart Season 2 (58:00), and the premiere weeks of Memories of the Alhambra and Encounter over in our Kdrama Corner (1:04:00).

You can let us know your thoughts in the comments below, or on our Podomatic page here.

blog.description: sami| marvel| merlin| sherlock| b99| sw| good omens| bi| feminist| she/her| infp| nw england| carol danvers said gay rights| no tony antis

summary: "I think she has an ego, but in a healthy way. She doesn’t have an unrealistic expectation of herself, she just owns that she’s...
body:
“I think she has an ego, but in a healthy way. She doesn’t have an unrealistic expectation of herself, she just owns that she’s really good and really skilled. Which feels good to play. She also has an incredible sense of humour, makes fun of herself, makes fun of other people and has no issue if someone makes fun of her.” -Brie Larson on playing Captain Marvel

this. this is what people, girls especially, need to know. you’re allowed to know you’re good at things. you’re allowed to take pride in your skills. you’re allowed to see that you are great. as long as it doesn’t become unbearably selfish. you are amazing and you deserve to know.

blog.name: dontworryimdis-arm-ed
blog.title: Oh no I hope I don't fall
blog.description: trans, he/him, depressed, and marvel obsessed

summary: Give me leave to rant a while
title: Give me leave to rant a while
body:
If you don’t like Brie Larson as Captain Marvel, or you think she’s boring, you might as well unfollow me now, because you’re gonna hate my blog for the next 6 months.

I hear a lot of complaints that Brie Larson isn’t interesting as Captain Marvel. I’ve heard that her facial expressions are all the same, that her lines are boring. She’s overpowered, she’s “there to please the feminists”, “too unrealistic,” “just like Green Lantern’s story”.

Listen up, you little shits.

Compare the Captain Marvel trailer to any of the other marvel movie trailers. If you’re gonna say Carol looks too serious, then ALL of the main marvel heroes look too serious. The facial expressions aren’t changing a lot for them because we aren’t shown scenes of serious emotion in trailers. They give us clips that make the movie look more exciting, like that gorgeous one above. 

“Just like Green Lantern’s origin”- WE HAVEN’T SEEN THE FUCKING MOVIE YET, HOW DO YOU KNOW EXACTLY HOW HER MCU ORIGIN WILL GO???

“There to please the feminists”- Marvel, unfortunately, didn’t seem to care about most of the female characters for a pretty long time. In the comics,  Captain Marvel has been around for quite a while. Marvel needs more female heroes on the big screen, Hell, they need more female characters that aren’t just love interests or minor side characters, and we’re finally getting them. How is that a bad thing?

“Too overpowered/ unrealistic”- Really? I’ve cried about

  • a sentient tree and a talking raccoon, 
  • a half-spider high-schooler magically turning into dust, 
  • and an 99-year-old frisbee champion on steroids losing his best friend (an 100-year-old amnesiac cyborg assassin) for like the 5th time. 
  • I’ve cared about siri with a magic rock in its head.

I don’t care how “realistic” Carol Danvers’ powers are. Superpowers aren’t a thing in our world, so all of this is unrealistic. Captain Marvel is no exception. She’s still fucking amazing and I love her, and hopefully her movie will be as amazing as she is. 

  • “Doesn’t smile enough”- Yeah, because everything else in the MCU is sunshine, unicorns, and rainbows. Would you give this same critique to Steve or Tony in CA:CW?

TL;DR:
The main complaints against Captain Marvel’s trailer are shitty and dumb, seeing as the trailer is done like any other marvel movie trailer. Any complaint against them could be made against any of the trailers, but somehow, it’s only a problem in the female-led movie, Captain Marvel. Huh.

These trailers have made my cold panromantic heart screech like a middle-schooler when their crush asks them to dance during their favorite song. I hope this movie does the same for you. 

P.S. some people also complained that she has the same last name as Supergirl. As someone who loves both my DC and Marvel children, Carol Danvers was a Danvers before Kara.

  • and an 99-year-old frisbee champion on steroids losing his best friend (an 100-year-old amnesiac cyborg assassin) for like the 5th time. 
  • I’ve cared about siri with a magic rock in its head.

I don’t care how “realistic” Carol Danvers’ powers are. Superpowers aren’t a thing in our world, so all of this is unrealistic. Captain Marvel is no exception. She’s still fucking amazing and I love her, and hopefully her movie will be as amazing as she is. 

  • “Doesn’t smile enough”- Yeah, because everything else in the MCU is sunshine, unicorns, and rainbows. Would you give this same critique to Steve or Tony in CA:CW?

TL;DR:
The main complaints against Captain Marvel’s trailer are shitty and dumb, seeing as the trailer is done like any other marvel movie trailer. Any complaint against them could be made against any of the trailers, but somehow, it’s only a problem in the female-led movie, Captain Marvel. Huh.

These trailers have made my cold panromantic heart screech like a middle-schooler when their crush asks them to dance during their favorite song. I hope this movie does the same for you. 

P.S. some people also complained that she has the same last name as Supergirl. As someone who loves both my DC and Marvel children, Carol Danvers was a Danvers before Kara.

blog.name: gwslibrarian
blog.title: UW Gender & Women's Studies Librarian
blog.description: Since its beginning in 1977, The Office of the UW System Gender and Women’s Studies (GWS) Librarian has been one of the premier resources for support of gender, women’s studies, and LGBT studies scholarship and librarianship. The GWS Librarian provides bibliographic and curriculum support, inter-institutional cooperation, information sharing, and advocacy related to the fields of women’s, gender, and LGBT studies and to gender-focused scholarship in the traditional disciplines.
